New Records: Tyler Herro set a franchise record with 70 straight games with at least one 3-pointer, breaking Duncan Robinson's mark of 69 games ending in 2021
Key Match Events: The Heat made the most of transition points (17-7) and hustle plays when it mattered
The Heat won a coaches challenge on a foul call on Walker Kessler, resulting in a jump ball and Jaquez making a 3-pointer with 1:03 to play
The Jazz had cut the lead to 90-88 but couldn't overcome the Heat's clutch play
Pre-Game Insights: The Jazz were missing six injured players, including Jordan Clarkson (foot), John Collins (hip), Keyonte George (heel), and Brice Sensabaugh
The Heat had lost nine in a row at home but had improved each game since Jimmy Butler's suspension
The Heat played without Kevin Love (personal reasons)
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Heat played without Kevin Love (personal reasons)
The Jazz had the worst team in the NBA at taking care of the ball
